intro: Regnaldia clutioides, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from violet to white. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other vines and climbers. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Regnaldia clutioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can grow up to several meters in length.
